results.title: Torvill and Dean: path to perfection
results.brief_description: Chronicles the rise of world ice-skating champions Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean. Shows eight dance routines from the World Championships in 1980, 1982 and 1983, the European championships from Budapest and the Williams and Glynn Gala in 1982.

results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 3: Episodes 8-10.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Life on the limit”, Extinction is forever”, and “Crackpot jackpot”. Contents include the ecological consequences of agriculture, the extinction of species, and the human role in evolution.

results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 2: Episodes 5-7.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Land of opportunity”, “Latitude zero”, and “White death: new life”. Contents include the botanical uniqueness of New Zealand, the role of animals in plant reproduction, the ecological contrasts of Ecuador’s Andes, and the glacial origins of Canada’s wheatlands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International

results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 1: Episodes 1-4.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Greenprint for life”, “The Crucible of life”, “Living Water”, and “Potential energy”. Contents include Amazon rain forest ecology, the emergence of the earliest life forms, marine ecology and the Peruvian trench, the evolutionary transition from sea to land and its legacy of peat and coal deposits.

results.title: Colombian gold: the sweat of the sun
results.brief_description: Provides a history of Colombia. Catalogues the destruction carried out by the Spanish conquistadores, the influence of the Spanish and Catholic Church and the way of life of the various tribes. The gold artefacts and their production techniques are explained by Clemica Plazas de Nieto, curator of the Museo del Oro, Bogota.

results.title: Small claims tribunal
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Follows the case of a consumer making a complaint to the Consumer Affairs Bureau about a dress that shrank after washing. The claim is subsequently settled before the Small Claims Tribunal. No other credits available
